intro: Chrysa, commonly known as the golden crown fern, is a striking plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its intricate, lace-like fronds. The plant produces small, yellowish spore cases that give it its common name. Chrysa thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining, acidic soil. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for indoor and outdoor gardens.
